climbs.name: Welcome to Bohemia
climbs.fa: Errett Allen, Karen Young, Bill Serniuk, Cory Hicks, Ken Yager and Grant Hiskes, 1989.

content.description:
From a fallen tree leaning against the base, climb a trough, to where the wall steepens.

Climb to a bolt then move left and up past 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
Climb to the first bolt on "Welcome to Bohemia". Move up and right to a bolt. Climb past 3 more bolts then move up and left to the anchor.

Somewhat of a 5.11 testpiece for the Mammoth Area.  Crux is right above the first bolt, and through the second bolt.  Climb a steep, technical bulge, that might require a somewhat dynamic move (it did for me being 5'7) for two bolts.  The route then eases over to a slab above this, which serves as a rest after the crux.  From there, the route continues up for 8 more bolts with a few tricky 5.10 sections.  Lower off.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a two bolt anchor which is equipped with steel carabiners for lowering off.

content.description:
Easy moves to the 2nd bolt and then straight into the brief but fingery crux before continuing up the long face above on large holds to a final difficult section over a bulge just below the top.

The upper section is much easier, but if severely pumped it could present a challenge.

A standout route of the area with enjoyable movement, great rock and a bit more climbing than most in the area.
content.location:
Around the corner to the right of

Jihad

on a narrow east-facing wall.
